alert.note: Alert for Allen; Avoyelles; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 10:51AM CST until January 24 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Avoyelles Parish in central Louisiana... Evangeline Parish in central Louisiana... Southeastern Rapides Parish in central Louisiana... Southeastern Allen Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Jefferson Davis Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 100 PM CST. * At 1051 AM CST, Public and radar indications are that water levels remain high from heavy rain received earlier this morning. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oakdale, Ville Platte, Marksville, Bunkie, Mamou, Iowa, Kinder, Oberlin, Elton, Moreauville, Cheneyville, Turkey Creek, Fenton, Effie, Bordelonville, Cottonport, Pine Prairie, Mansura, Hessmer and Evergreen. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Avoyelles; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides
